image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'What happened to any time, any place?', asks Kamala after Trump backs off his commitment to debate in September
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris has questioned Donald Trump’s commitment to a debate scheduled for September 10 after his apparent backpedalling. Trump’s team cited “political chaos” surrounding Biden’s exit and Harris’s provisional status as reasons for reconsideration. Harris, however, insists on the debate, accusing Trump of avoiding the clash. Trump hints at preferring Fox News for the debate but has not confirmed his participation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Unesco body holds Russia responsible for destruction of Ukrainian cultural heritage
item.dc:creator: Rudroneel Ghosh

item.title: 'Most used rocket' SpaceX's Falcon 9 gets green light to return to Space
item.description: ​​The FAA said on Friday that it found no public safety concerns related to the anomaly that occurred during the unsuccessful launch on July 11, allowing the rocket to return to flight operations while the comprehensive investigation proceeds.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Not helpful': How Nikki Haley criticized attacks on Kamala Harris over gender and race
item.description: Nikki Haley has criticised attacks on Vice President Kamala Harris based on her race and gender, urging focus on her policy shortcomings instead. In a CNN interview, Haley highlighted Harris's lack of accomplishments, failed handling of illegal immigration, and progressive stance, which she believes makes Harris a less effective choice than Biden.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Prince Harry 'won't bring wife Meghan Markle back' to UK, here's why
item.description: Prince Harry has announced that Meghan Markle will not accompany him on future UK visits due to severe safety concerns linked to media scrutiny. In an ITV interview, Harry expressed fears over potential threats influenced by tabloid coverage. He also discussed the broader impact of media harassment on their lives and reflected on the support from his late grandmother, Queen Elizabeth II.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Texas rocked by multiple earthquakes: What’s causing the shaking?
item.description: A series of earthquakes, including a magnitude 4.9 tremor, hit Scurry County, West Texas, on Monday. Experts link the quakes to local oil production methods, specifically enhanced oil recovery. This process involves injecting water or carbon dioxide into oil fields, which can induce seismic activity. The recent quakes highlight a rise in earthquake frequency due to these methods.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Largest wildfire in California this year started by a burning car pushed into a gully; 1 arrested
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Ella Emhoff defending Kamala Harris from JD Vance’s 'childless cat lady' remark?
item.description: Ella Emhoff defended Kamala Harris against JD Vance's 'childless' remark made in 2021, by emphasizing her and her brother's relationship with Harris. Emhoff, a Parsons fashion student turned model, has also faced criticism for supporting a controversial fundraiser. She gained public attention with her fashion choices during Harris’s inauguration.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Act with urgency': California governor Newsom orders urgent dismantling of homeless camps
item.description: California governor Gavin Newsom has ordered the dismantling of thousands of homeless encampments following a Supreme Court ruling granting governments broader removal powers. The directive, applying to state agencies, aims to address health and safety threats but has sparked debate. Critics argue it fails to tackle the root causes of homelessness and may exacerbate the issue.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Devastating wildfires ravage Jasper, Alberta: Mass evacuations and international firefighting efforts
item.description: Wildfires have devastated the Canadian town of Jasper, destroying up to half of the community and forcing the evacuation of 25,000 people. Triggered by a lightning storm and driven by strong winds, the fires levelled streets and left smouldering ruins. The blaze remains out of control despite global firefighting support and some rain. This disaster highlights severe fire conditions across North America.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'How can you be childless': Kamala Harris' stepdaughter says she loves three parents
item.description: ​Ella Emhoff has now come out in the support of stepmother, vice president Kamala Harris in the 'childless cat ladies' row and questioned how can she be "childless" when there are "cutie pie kids" like Cole and herself. She cited her biological mother Kerstin Emhoff's statement issued earlier over the issue as she supporter her 'momala' Kamala.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Face behind hack: US identifies North Korean man behind stolen data from Nasa, military, hospitals; offer $10 million reward
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Burning car pushed into gully, lightning fan Western US wildfires
item.description: California's Park Fire, caused by a burning car, led to evacuations and scorched 110 square miles. Oregon and Idaho faced lightning-induced fires, while Montana and southern California grappled with heat and strong winds. Climate change has intensified wildfire threats across regions, causing evacuation orders, power outages, and air quality alerts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
